title: Old South Church
shortSummary: A historic Congregationalist church at Copley Square, built in 1875.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: Trinity Church Boston
shortSummary: A masterpiece of Richardsonian Romanesque architecture, completed in 1877.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: Park Street Church
shortSummary: Founded in 1809, this evangelical church stands at the corner of Park and Tremont Streets.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: King's Chapel
shortSummary: The first Anglican church built in Boston (1686), later becoming the first Unitarian church in America.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: Old North Church
shortSummary: Boston's oldest surviving church (1723), famous for the lanterns that signaled Paul Revere's ride.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: Cathedral of the Holy Cross
shortSummary: The mother church of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Boston, built in 1875.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: Temple Israel of Boston
shortSummary: One of New England's largest Reform Jewish congregations, founded in 1854.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: Mosque for the Praising of Allah
shortSummary: A prominent Boston mosque serving the Muslim community in the Back Bay and Fenway neighborhoods.
imageAttribution: Photo: Courtesy of the Islamic Society of Boston

title: First Baptist Church in America
shortSummary: Founded in 1665, one of the oldest Baptist congregations in the United States.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons

title: Saint Paul's Cathedral
shortSummary: A Greek Revival Episcopal cathedral built in 1820, located on Tremont Street across from Boston Common.
imageAttribution: Photo: Public domain via Wikimedia Commons
